laboratory_examinations.findings: Patient 1: HIV RNA level was 85,000 copies/mL in October 1995; Patient 2: HIV RNA level was 1,500,000 copies/mL in June 1996.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient 1: experienced fluctuations in HIV RNA load with a rebound after initial reduction. Patient 2: HIV RNA level decreased over time from 1,500,000 copies/mL to 1,000,000 copies/mL at the point of referral.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Patient 1: CD4 T cell count at 55 cells/mL in October 1995, remained consistently <100 cells/mL during the study. Patient 2: CD4 T cell count at 48 cells/mL in June 1996, dropped to 8 cells/mL upon referral.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient 1: no increase in CD4 T cell count observed throughout the treatment. Patient 2: consistent decline in CD4 T cell count.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Patient 1: initially showed effective reduction in HCMV load; however, mutations indicative of drug resistance emerged. Patient 2: showed mutations in UL97 associated with ganciclovir resistance.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient 1: developed persistent relapses of HCMV retinitis with increasing HCMV load over time. Patient 2: developed first episode of HCMV retinitis in June 1999, with presence of mutations in UL97 noted thereafter.
